website_summaries.verdict: Simple design that anyone can use. Single pitter, but works through a lot of cherries faster than expected.
pros: A sturdy unit that will last a long time
Easy to use with one hand
cons: No splatter guard, which may create a mess

customer_reviews.title: Wow! It Really Works!!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful kitchen tool! Best of all it works perfect! Cherries are such 'a pain' to pit. This cherry pitting tool works like magic! I pitted a flat of cherries in less than two hours. Yay! Went through dishwasher, totally clean, & think it is built to last forever. I'll be passing this on to my grandkids. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Rene H. White

customer_reviews.title: Seed out!
customer_reviews.text: This is so awesome! It is really great quality. It feels like it is made very well and won't break on me after a couple uses. This is perfect for families with little kids so you can take the seed out of the cherry and little kids can enjoy cherries without you having to worry about them swallowing the seed or becoming a mess while biting around the seed trying to get it out. One of my favorite things I've bought on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Like cherries? You'll love this!
customer_reviews.text: I'd been warned that pitting cherries was a messy job, and I should prepare my kitchen with lots of paper towels, not to mention wear an apron. However, NONE of this was needed! The cherry pitter worked perfectly and easily. There was little to no mess, and I went through about a pound and a half of cherries in way less time than I originally thought it would take. Brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: ChibiNMe

customer_reviews.title: Wont work with small cherries
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife, who has small cherries the size of small green olives. I believe they are the 'martha washington' type. The description says it will do small cherries as well as olives. The small cherries push right down into the cup, it would be nice if there was a plastic cap of some sort to make the cup smaller. I wont try to return it, as it works just a little better than a paring knife.
customer_reviews.author: Brad W.

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Pitter So Far in This Life
customer_reviews.text: Tried a few pitters before this one-that turned out to have been a waste of time: This is the one for me. It's quick, efficient, relatively tidy (they are cherries, after all), easy to clean, locking mech functions well. What more do you need in s cherry pitter? Oh yeah, it's red !~! I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: Ormond & Lynda M Otvos

customer_reviews.title: Okay - ish.
customer_reviews.text: Jaws do not open wide enough, and 'bowl' is too small for the biggest Californian cherries. Also, the pitter would benefit from having a return spring, to open the jaws after each pitt.
customer_reviews.author: Clem

customer_reviews.title: Simple, and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a product that actually works, with no extra pieces to wash (or lose if you are like me! Lol) this is the one for you. I have two small boys who are OBSESSED with cherries this season. This product is super simple, and quick to use, and the best part is you can see if the pit comes out of it. No guessing games. It feels sturdy in your hand, no bending or give when you squeeze it. I am sure I will never need to buy another one. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sallie

customer_reviews.title: This one is much more sturdy, but doesn't always get the pits like the ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a broken plastic cherry pitter I purchased from Amazon several years ago. This one is much more sturdy, but doesn't always get the pits like the other one did. Not bad for the price, and certainly sturdy, but meh...
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: The cherry pitter is nicely made, but it does not function properly
customer_reviews.text: The cherry pitter is nicely made, but it does not function properly. The small cylinder the you rest the cherry on is smaller than the ferry. When you press the pitter together, it mashes ripe cherries as well as extracting the pit. That's fine if you are making a pie but if you are displaying the cherries, their appearance is destroyed. My previous cherry pitter had a cherry sized cup that held the cherries in place while you pressed the pitter down. Unfortunately it broke after many years of service. This one looks very sturdy, and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Gustavsen

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk - broke after just 10 cherries!!
customer_reviews.text: Complete piece of junk. Lasted 10 cherries then it inexplicably fell apart. See attached photo. I will say for the first 9 cherries it did a great job of removing the pits. However, the quality is way below sub par. Maybe you can get a good one, but you can also end up with a piece of junk like I did. Not recommended at all - look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Meckfessel

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: I looked at other cherry pitters and many had a common issue of not being rugged enough. This one is not one of them. It is two solid metal pieces and can handle cherries and olives with ease. The day I got it I used it to pit 3 lbs. of cherries and was thoroughly impressed with the craftsmanship and durability of it. For anyone who enjoys fresh cherries (or olives), I highly recommend this cherry pitter.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Burns

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gadget !
customer_reviews.text: My first thought was..do I really want to pit cherries? But I always wanted to make a cherry pie from scratch ..so I ordered this . This gadget is well made ..easy to use ..and so well worth the money. It even came with an ecookbook. I made the cherry pie and it was absolutely delicious. Well worth the effort !
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K.

customer_reviews.title: Does not consistently pit the cherries
customer_reviews.text: I've used this tool a couple of times now and I've decided that I am disappointed in it because there were too many cherries that still had the pit in them after I used the tool on it. I would expect a failure rate of 1 or 2 cherries in a pie. After I pitted all of the cherries, there were more like 5 to 8 that still had the pits in them. So if your aim is a little off when you put the cherry in the tool, the pit stays in. I honestly had the best results using a thick straw to pit cherries. That straw pitted every cherry.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Nixon

customer_reviews.title: A total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't eject the pit so you have to dig it out. Your hand ends up messy and totally defeats the purpose of a cherry pitter. My kid broke the Oxo pitter I'd had for many years. This was a lightning deal for $6 so I thought I'd give it a try. A total waste of money. I'm ordering anas soon as I finish typing this review.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart on first use.
customer_reviews.text: When we received the item the pin and cup were out of alignment. The pin almost touched the side of the hole in the cup. The tool literally fell apart in my hand after only about 20 cherries were done. The hinge has a very light swage to hold it together and it just down right failed. Instead of hassling with trying to return it, I took it out to the shop and drilled a hole through the center of the hinge casting and put it back together with a screw and nylock nut. Also corrected the misalignment of the tool ends. Very poor engineering and manufacture, sorry. Not worth two bits the way it was.
customer_reviews.author: Grampz

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It's been a good little tool. We have a cherry tree in our back yard and this little tool takes the work of pitting them. We use fresh cherries in a lot of recipies. Needless to say, it's been used a lot and still pitting. Quality so far is very good.
customer_reviews.author: debbien

customer_reviews.title: Not just for cherries
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this to use on large olives. And it works great. The olive pitter I had restricted the size olive I could use. This is open and and pitted the Atlas Olives that I have...which are bigger than cherries. Perfect size and stores easily in drawer, has a clasp at end of handle to keep compact.
customer_reviews.author: Lakegirl70

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: I could swear my cherries are normal size but apparently they’re massive because this pitter smashes them while taking the pit out. When looking at other pitters I see that the actually pitting part is quite short...hence the smashing. I guess I got a different one then the rest of the reviewers which is a bummer. I’ll be looking for a new one and keeping an eye on the length.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I have tried using this device and it pretty much crushes the cherry. It does remove the pit. Maybe I am doing it wrong but I don't see that there could be any other way. It's cheap, but unless you are making cherry pie or something like that where it doesn't matter if the cherry is crushed, I would stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Mark N.

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad Manufacturing. After couple of usage itself
customer_reviews.text: Very Bad Manufacturing. After couple of usage itself, both parts of this Pitter is separated. I am just wondered how they are fixed both parts.? It looks like both parts are fixed using the painted coating in other side. After the couple of usage itself, that painted coating will go away, then both pieces will be separated.
customer_reviews.author: Reni Raphy

customer_reviews.title: What an awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a handy tool! It is always so hard to get hose pits out of the cherries after I pick or purchase them. This handy little tool makes that job effortless. It is made from heavy duty metal, so you don't have to worry about it breaking on you. Save your self some time and buy this lifesaving tool!
customer_reviews.author: Staci S.

customer_reviews.title: I was extremely happy with this cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely happy with this cherry pitter. Even if you don't do a lot cherries, this is well worth the money. The added plus is that the cherries end up looking much nicer than doing them manually. Would absolutely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A model of functional design
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for pitting olives. Would I had bought it sooner and saved myself a hefty dentist's bill for repairing a tooth that I broke biting on an olive pit. The slick black finish makes it easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Michael  Webb

customer_reviews.title: Removes the pits easily!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little cherry pitter. It does exactly what it is supposed to do. Place the cherry on the circular end and clasp the handles together, and the seed pops out! Realize that pitting cherries is a labor intensive job....they need to be done one at a time. The tool also seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: research4u

customer_reviews.title: Great pitter
customer_reviews.text: It might take a few cherries to get the hang of it, and a few you will have to move around just a bit so the pit will get pushed cleanly through the hole, but this is a great pitter. Good, heavy feel to it. It has a spring action on it so it opens back up after you pit the cherry, and for storage, you can latch the two ends of the handle together.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: The mechanism that holds the two levers together broke in half the first time I used the cherry pitter. Really poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Aerel

customer_reviews.title: Not ergonomic but works.
customer_reviews.text: This works as intended, but could be made better. It's not very ergonomic and does hurt your hands after a while. I really should have bought one that does more than 1 cherry at a time. I buy the cherries on sale and then pit them It took me about an hour or so to pit about 3 lbs of cherries.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Castaldo

customer_reviews.title: Easy and reliable with all sizes of cherries.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy on the hands good, cherry stoner. I put up 9 quarts of cherries this year using this pitter. Yes there are faster ones using a spring loaded plunger, but often these jam or miss the pit. I this method.
customer_reviews.author: canonwren

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pitter for All Hands
customer_reviews.text: I pitted five pounds of cherries for jam in less than a hour. This is a great tool. It works on all sizes of cherries without mangling them. Super easy to use. I have carpal tunnel and my hand never once got sore or fell asleep while working through pounds and pounds of cherries. I highly recommend this pitter. I suffered no fatigue and the cherries came out beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie Hyslop

customer_reviews.title: Solid tool
customer_reviews.text: Sturdier than the multi-cherry plastic pitters, but once I had the technique a pound of cherries went very quickly. The bright red is kinda cool and easy to find in the "whatever" drawer......
customer_reviews.author: CharlieOldGuy

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: As some other reviewers have stated and posted pictures, ours broke on the third use. My wife estimates she pitted approximately 100-150 cherries before the rivet holding it together let go. This is a poor design and I would caution shoppers to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: matthew house

customer_reviews.title: Not used yet but I think it will be great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cherry pitter to replace a model I had bought that has a container to catch the pitted fruit. Most of the time the cherries do not even get pitted and I gave it to Goodwill! I have not used this one yet but have used one of the same design made from another metal. It worked great and I am trusting that this one will perform equally well. The price on this pitter was also much lower!
customer_reviews.author: Linda T

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cherry pitter! Easiest when you align the stem side of the cherry with the punch part of the pitter. Always be sure to look at the cherry you just pitted to make sure the pit isn't hanging on by a piece of cherry flesh. As long as you do that, you're good to go! Easy, heavy duty, looks like it will last many years!
customer_reviews.author: kaytots

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for what it is made for.
customer_reviews.text: I love tools that do the job they were intended for. This one pits cherries very well. It would probably do the same for olives. It is well made and not bad looking. But, unless you do fresh cherries a lot it's gonna be a drawer cluttering device.
customer_reviews.author: Mike3746

customer_reviews.title: I was super impressed with how sturdy this was
customer_reviews.text: I was super impressed with how sturdy this was. It did the job not only on cherries but quite effectively on olives as well and without squishing them. I LOVE that I can put it in the dishwasher and that it isn't cumbersome so it easier fits in the drawer with my other fun gadgets! :)
customer_reviews.author: shellgaspar

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Broke during first use. Also sharp metal shards were sticking out from the tool that could come off and get in food.
customer_reviews.author: Bernardo Mandri-#2 GFOP

customer_reviews.title: Good cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty cherry litter. No issues with it. Not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Love - love - love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not the kind of person that ever thought about getting this ... Common a cheery Pieter!!! But I did and I have to say once u get the hang of it .... It's ....it's awesome ... It totally takes out the pits and leaves it nice and pitless for my kids .. They just eat them and i don't have to worry about them getting chocked on a pit! I love it- a must have!!!
customer_reviews.author: claudia

customer_reviews.title: and a great tool to have in our kitchen drawer
customer_reviews.text: Item came on time, was packaged well, was as described, and a great tool to have in our kitchen drawer. We may need to get another one, so my husband and son don't have to share when they both want to snack on cherries, but one is watching TV in the living room and the other is in the basement playing video games:)
customer_reviews.author: AmazonQueen1012

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as house warming gift. Have one and love it. I buy a lot more cherries now. Sooo easy
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer  DFJones

customer_reviews.title: Nifty!
customer_reviews.text: Take care you snip the pit into a bowl before handing it off to top your morning cereal. Those ripe cherry juices! "Out damn spot." Pity the cherry season is finished.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Evans

customer_reviews.title: better than using a knife
customer_reviews.text: Lightening deal for 6 bucks. Works well pushing pits out the bottom Key element is the spring that opens the devise. If it remains strong super by. If it last less than a year ok. Either way better than removing the pits with a paring knife.
customer_reviews.author: Jim James

customer_reviews.title: favorite kitchen helpers
customer_reviews.text: what a great product. I pitted a huge bag of cherries in no time the day after it arrived and didn't stain my nails. "Cherry cobbler or cherry pie anyone, it's great."
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kay

customer_reviews.title: Good tool and good value
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Well made. Good price. As others have noted, it definitely splatters a little (which can be bad for bigger and darker cherries—lots of staining!). But if you go slow you can avoid. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: excellent cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: My husband just loves his cherry pitter. He tried a cheap plastic one and finally decided I was right and a metal one was the best choice. Thank you for providing reasonably priced excellent working tool.
customer_reviews.author: Dana L. Packman

customer_reviews.title: Not very useful to me
customer_reviews.text: I found this tool cumbersome and unpleasant to use. Juice and goo went all over and the pits didn't pop out cleanly. I wasn't inclined to try it for long. I don't think it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: CatieBee

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOOL FOR PITTING CHERRIES!!!
customer_reviews.text: This s an amazing tool!! It is very well made, and works like a charm!! I was more than impressed at how well everything about the tool is. I plan on doing some cooking with cherries, and really did NOT want to cut open all the cherries... now I can create some interesting desserts with ease... the tool works beyond my expectations!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: A bit awkward, but I have small hands. Works well to pit.
customer_reviews.author: H and S

customer_reviews.title: A must if you have kids
customer_reviews.text: Finally - the kid can pit her own cherries. Easy to use, easy to train a 7 year old to use, much less mess. It looks like it will last forever, no wonder they offer lifetime warranty
customer_reviews.author: Solnishko

customer_reviews.title: easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: painless cherry pitting. I was surprised how quickly the pits came out! no more pits!!
customer_reviews.author: SpunkyYogi

customer_reviews.title: Fair product.
customer_reviews.text: Came in an opened package and felt a but greasy.. not an issue. Didn’t work as well as I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Bouchard

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 20 days!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this items and owned it less than a month before breaking. I was so excited to receive this cherry pitter. It worked great AT FIRST and was fast and fairly clean. Less than a month later (I only used it 4-5 times) it completely came apart and does not appear that it can be fixed. BUMMER...
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent delivery and communication by the seller. What an ingenious little tool. I was able to pit a whole bag of cherries in a little over 15 minutes once I got the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: surfside22

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality, broke the first day we used it. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SME324

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed. I've been looking locally for a few years (at least during cherry season) without luck. I was leery at first because it was so much better priced than other cherry pitters, but it works great, my kids can safely and easily use it, and I don't end up with stained hands. Wish I would have checked Amazon sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve Wagner

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: All this thing does is smoosh the cherries and make a mess. It might work okay with tiny cherries but my finger and nails are all stained from how much of a mess it made with the large, juicy cherries we love.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal G

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use!
customer_reviews.text: This cherry potter broke on the first use, after pitting about 12 cherries. I'm returning this defective product for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: PaddyJasmine

customer_reviews.title: Get if you like no pits in your olives or cherries.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple tool but does exactly what I want. Cherries and Olives don't stand a chance against me now.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Helsel

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: The cherry pitter works well & easy to use! Plus an email will arrive with recipes for cherries and some history about the different varieties!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Breeze to use!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly and easily--red is easy to find in my cluttered kitchen implements drawer--and has latch to hold itself closed when just in that drawer
customer_reviews.author: MJ M

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a cherry pitter, and I was pleased at how easy it was to remove the pits. I pit a very large bowl of cherries in less than 30 minutes while watching TV at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: SLee

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome tool! I wasn't really sold that it would ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome tool! I wasn't really sold that it would be worthwhile, but I was seriously wrong - worth every penny and a bargain indeed!
customer_reviews.author: ASandefur

customer_reviews.title: It’s a very durable product.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the pitter is heavy in my hand. It’s a very sturdy product and once I pitted a few cherries I had the technique down.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly JoAnn

customer_reviews.title: Not good for large/Ranier cherries
customer_reviews.text: Works well on small & medium bing cherries. Does NOT work for large Ranier cherries as advertised - the stem is too short, so if you press it all the way down on a large cherry to get the pit out, you will smash the cherry.
customer_reviews.author: Thoppe

customer_reviews.title: works and the price it great i think- seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: at first i did not think this would work but it miraculously pushed the pit from the bottom and made it possible for my kids to eat with out me having to take the pit out with my mother mouth!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly F.

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: like magic..what took me an hour to pit, I made a pie today and pitted four cups in a few minutes...wonderful tool...thank youl
customer_reviews.author: Gypsyjoe  DiPasquale

customer_reviews.title: Paint job not great.
customer_reviews.text: I like the simplicity of it and it works well. Not the best paint job. It had paint bubbles that burst, so hope it doesn't rust. It would have been 5 starts if not for that.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This item is wonderful and very easy to use. My 3 yr old loved using and he was very happy to help with what the family was doing. The quality is wonderful. We bought 3 pitters and we were able to pit the cherries very quickly thanks to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Buy
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product - the kids work it, quick easy, fast cleanup, stores compact - this is probably my FAVORITE amazon buy to date. Enjoyable cherry snacks without the mess every time.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri T

customer_reviews.title: Cherry Potter by Ionox
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with the item I received. It is sturdy, not made of plastic, and at this time I believe it to be very durable. Thank you. The price is also very acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: phanuelsdaughter

customer_reviews.title: Works great. If you need to do a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. If you need to do a lot of cherries buy one with more capacity. Perfect if you don't need to do a lot of cherries
customer_reviews.author: royalwing

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this makes pitting cherries a breeze. I can't believe it took me this long to buy one.
customer_reviews.author: amyfaerie

customer_reviews.title: This works pretty well for the price
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well for the price. Not quite as quick or neat as the spring loaded type that screws on a mason jar, but I was still able to pit a gallon of cherries in an hour or so. Good customer service and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's cherry season and we just went through 45 lbs of cherries with this pitter for freezing and smoothies. Good quality, easy to use. I'm ready to start on the next week's pick. This tool does what it is meant to do.
customer_reviews.author: the royster

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made and seem sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Seem durable and easy to handle. I haven't actually used them yet so I'm not sure how it'll work. Hopefully the size of the cherry won't matter and I can use them for olives, too.
customer_reviews.author: Susan in Cincinnati

customer_reviews.title: About half of the time, the pits went to ...
customer_reviews.text: About half of the time, the pits went to the side of the cherry. Not sure I'd purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Mother Earth

customer_reviews.title: Used this just once and it works fine. My cherries were large and plump and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this just once and it works fine. My cherries were large and plump and the pits came out nicely.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Reader

customer_reviews.title: Well made and works great
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Very well made and I even got a free online cherry cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: book maven

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing and easy
customer_reviews.text: After my son swallowed a cherry whole and was choking, I bought this device. It's amazing and easy. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: kim l

customer_reviews.title: Super easy and quick
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old has discovered her love for cherries but doesn’t understand how to eat around a pit. This has come in handy. I hate having to cut the pit out.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy compared to other pitters I have had. Can't beat an unconditional lifetime warranty!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: EZ to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to handle, and very effective in pitting cherries, exactly what I needed!!
customer_reviews.author: online shopper

customer_reviews.title: A Must For Any Cherry Lover
customer_reviews.text: It's a cool little gadget that anyone who loves cherries must have- cut time to pit also doesn't waste fruit- easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.author: tien

customer_reviews.title: this product feels well built and sturdy. The design is tried and true
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. Overall, this product feels well built and sturdy. The design is tried and true.
customer_reviews.author: DMc

customer_reviews.title: Works well and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Arrived quickly. Works well and easy to clean. No cheap plastic parts to break. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little device
customer_reviews.text: Great little device. I was able to pit a full pound of cherries in about a minute. i really like the locking device at the end of the handles. Cleans easily, very smooth action.
customer_reviews.author: Geno

customer_reviews.title: We love this cherry pitcher
customer_reviews.text: We love this cherry pitcher, it is very simple and easy to use, even our 2 year old enjoys removing cherry pitch now.
customer_reviews.author: tbezerra

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised just takes a tiny bit of getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget to have.
customer_reviews.text: Cherry potter is very well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Made of solid material, easy to clean, and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We love this cherry pitter my son used it and his very happy with the result!!! will boy again!
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy with good weight to it to effectively remove pits. The only down-side is it does not have a splatter shield, so cherry juice kind of flies around!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy E. Mickle

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun to use
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous item. Just as described. Works with all sizes of cherries. A lot of fun to use. Easy to clean. Very sturdy. Great for a gift also.
customer_reviews.author: brooksie

customer_reviews.title: A nice tool
customer_reviews.text: A very simple tool that works as advertised. Nice finish, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for grand daughter
customer_reviews.text: My grand daughter is doing great with pitter than I am. Believe or not, She's 4 years old. I asked her to help me how. She's doing great. I'm glad, I have her to help me.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki E. Newport

customer_reviews.title: This cherry pitter has a nice sturdy feel to it
customer_reviews.text: This cherry pitter has a nice sturdy feel to it. When I used it, I was very happy with how well this worked. GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: vicky blommer

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool! Never knew such a gizmo existed until I saw my friend use one - the cherries aren't crushed at all, and it's so easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Madear 503

customer_reviews.title: I love cherries. This tool works great
customer_reviews.text: I love cherries. This tool works great. Heavy duty too.
customer_reviews.author: gamebug

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: This pitter broke after 2 cherries... The product was heavy but had basicly nothing keeping it together it fell apart essentially right out of the box, complete waste. DO NOT PURCHASE ONE.
customer_reviews.author: William Lidstone

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Simple, sturdy, effective and very easy to use. Just what I want in a kitchen implement. It quickly pits cherries and olives so I can get on with my recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Cherry Pitter - Heavy Duty Zinc Alloy Cherry Stoner [Ion-1R] Red
product_meta.description:
We like easy to clean kitchen tools and that don't require an instruction manual, and the Ionox Cherry Pitter is just that. 

* Made with solid zinc alloy for years of use 

* Exclusive red finish that will not stain or discolor your hands 

* Locking ring for compact flat storage in a draw or in a storage container 

* Sping loaded so it is easy to use with one hand 

* Dishwasher safe on the bottom shelf 

* NO manuals 

* Lifetime warranty (see below) 

 

 The Ionox Cherry Pitter has a nice smooth feel to it, and fits in large and small hands with comfort. The pitter has an internal spring which opens the jaws every time so it is always ready for the next cherry. Easy to use with one hand feeding cherries and the other hand squeezing the pitter.

 

We Love Fresh Cherries 

 

 For people who love fresh cherries, and passionately use them frequently in baked goods or just eat them one at a time, the Ionox Cherry Pitter is a great option to pit lots of cherries without much effort. They are great as gifts. Buy several and gift them to friends and family.

 

We Crave for Cherry Deals 

* Look for our buy 3 get 1 free Amazon coupon and other coupons below. 

 

Lifetime Warranty & Satisfaction Guarantee 

 If you are not 100% satisfied you can return it no questions asked. Call us if you have a problem, and we will do our best to make you happy. If your cherry pitter breaks for any reason, we have a lifetime warranty program to replace place your cherry pitter.
feature_bullets: EASY TO USE: Removes the cherry stone quickly with little to no hand fatigue. Cleans up fast. Just use warm water & soap, or put it in the dishwasher. No complicated parts. 100% satisfaction Guarantee - if you can't pit enough cherry pits for a pie in 4 - 6 minutes (that's 4 cups of cored cherries) we'll give you your money back! We will also send you a FREE Cherry Recipe & Pitting eBook with over 30 classic and exclusive recipes and amusing pitting cherries facts.

PERFECT CHERRIES every time: Our cherry pit remover works great for Bing and Rainier cherries, as well as small and large cherries. Won't bruise cherries, no mess or minimal wasted fruit. If your goal is to have whole cherries that are not smashed or deformed this is the perfect tool. Easy to use for baking, canning, freezing, dehydrating and just eating cherries.

DISHWASHER SAFE: Will not tarnish, stain, or discolour from cherry juice or in the dishwasher. You can put your cherry corer in the bottom shelf too. The sealed spring action will not collect food particles or cherry juice. This is an old fashioned cherry pitter updated for today's kitchen and food safety standards.

LASTs A LIFETIME: Professional grade heavy-duty construction designed to last for years. Made made a Zinc Alloy, the cherry pitter is easy to hold and operate with one hand. The non-corrosive finish will not impart any metallic or any other flavors in your cherries.

LIFETIME WARRANTY: If the Ionox Cherry Pitter tool breaks or fails to perform for any reason, we will replace it free of charge for any reason. Just call us, send an email or file a warranty request, and we will send you a replacement. We don't think the dog will chew it and it won't melt in the dishwasher, but we have seen some crazy ways our customers use our pitter and are happy to send a replacement.
